intro: Potentilla verna subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as white sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features wiry, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
